abstract: Adoption of body cameras by police departments across country has led to debate over who has right to view footage; departments have begun using or testing cameras following series of controversial police killings; some departments, like Seattle, have begun uploading footage to YouTube, leading to privacy fears; many states have proposed exempting footage from public records laws, citing concern over disturbing imagery.
lead_paragraph: While some departments cite privacy concerns or the administrative burden of making the videos available to the public, the Seattle police post everything.

headline.main: Downside of Police Body Cameras: Your Arrest Hits YouTube
